title: Presidents of the 5th Republic
excerpt: From the 1986 EDSA Revolution to the Present.
content:
1. CORAZON C. AQUINO (1986–1992)
Assumed office after the EDSA People Power Revolution. She oversaw the drafting of the 1987 Constitution and focused on restoring democracy.

2. FIDEL V. RAMOS (1992–1998)
Known for his 'Philippines 2000' economic program, which aimed to make the Philippines a newly industrialized country.

3. JOSEPH EJERCITO ESTRADA (1998–2001)
Former actor known for his pro-poor stance ('Erap Para sa Mahirap'). His presidency was cut short by the Second EDSA Revolution.

4. GLORIA MACAPAGAL-ARROYO (2001–2010)
Economist and daughter of former President Diosdado Macapagal. She served the remainder of Estrada's term and won a full term in 2004.

5. BENIGNO S. AQUINO III (2010–2016)
Son of Corazon Aquino. His administration ('Daang Matuwid') focused on anti-corruption and economic growth.

6. RODRIGO ROA DUTERTE (2016–2022)
Known for his strong stance against illegal drugs and the 'Build, Build, Build' infrastructure program.

7. FERDINAND R. MARCOS JR. (2022–Present)
Son of former President Ferdinand Marcos. His campaign focused on unity ('Sama-sama Tayo Babangon Muli').
